attributes.action: Repeal five year fixed term parliaments.Return to a four year fixed term.
attributes.additional_details: Most democratic presidents and governments around the world have only four year terms.Which was the case for the UK up until 2008.Five years is too long to put up with a failing government.Now is the time to reduce this temporary forced/fixed term situation.
attributes.background: Since the 2008 financial crash.The then coalition government of tories and liberal democrats.Abolished the then fixed term from four years to five years.This was said at the time as a temporary measure to enable stability in the economy while we avoided bankruptcy.

rejection.details:
The Fixed Term Parliament Act was repealed in 2022. We have a maximum term of five years but the Government can call an election at any time.

If you would like changes to this, you could start a petition about that.
